author: Trent Clark
title: Ebro Proclaims Drake Is Bringing House Music Back ‚Äî Kaytranada & Twitter Say #GTFOHWTBS
text:
‚Äî Frank Buff (@brooklynbuff) March 20, 2017 @oldmanebro did you miss "Fade" by a certain Kanye West? 
‚Äî The Public Stand (@rolfmulder) March 20, 2017 @oldmanebro Puerto Rican's still play house and freestyle music 
Most notable among the detractors was multifaceted Montreal producer Kaytranada, who responded to Ebro‚Äôs claims with a proverbial sit-up-in-your-seat tweet: ‚Äú*clears throat* say what?‚Äù *clears throat* say what? https://t.co/bdyHIju3kw 
‚Äî KAYTRANADA (@KAYTRANADA) March 20, 2017 
HipHopDX‚Äôs 2016 Producer of The Year increased his already thriving fanbase thanks to his breakout album, 99.9% , which drew inspiration from elements of Hip Hop, R&B, electronica and yep, you guessed it, house music. The album featured guest spots from Anderson .Paak, Vic Mensa, Phonte and others, and was ranked #4 on HipHopDX‚Äôs Best Albums of 2016 . 
While the percentage of what Ebro actually believes in that tweet is debatable, he sure did have a fun time retweeting some of his more passionate mentions. Especially the ones who were up on his shenanigans. 
‚Äî OldMan Ebro (@oldmanebro) March 20, 2017 Twitter needs to suspend Ebro's account for a bit üòÇ https://t.co/3sDN7kbyMg
